39454491.review:
Simple fun, quick fun, hectic fun, lots of fun... this game has it all there. I started playing the game without having seen the reviews on steam and I was amazed at how much fun it is, seeing the reviews it all adds up.
While it is a fairly simple game, it is perfect for some quick in and out arcade/strategy fun. Its an action game that can be characterized as a mix of strategy, RTS and tower defence shooter.... Taking control of an elite squad of space marines all you need to do is kick some alien butt... actually lots and lots and lots of alien butts because there are soooo many of them.
Part of the fun is the wild shootouts killing hundreds of aliens each step you take towards your goal. The stages are fairly similar and while the goals are very similar as well there is a bit of strategic thinking involved into what upgrades to include for each mission (there are some single mission upgrades you can buy before starting) that provide you with some extra firepower, more soldiers, healing, different weapons and they can make a difference.
One of the best aspects of the game is the aliens themselves, which mutate and in many ways make each experience slightly different. The graphics are  simple but server their purpose amazingly well, everything is viewed from the top down perspective and the immense numbers of aliens didn't seem to bother my shabby laptop.
Don't expect the second coming and don't expect to play this forever, its not that... what you will do is engage quite a bit for a few days and then maybe go back from time to time for some hectic quick "relaxing" fun. I used it to alleviate my frustrations with my Long Dark experience.

Besides the main campaign there are some other challenges you can take up.

At full price it might be a bit expensive, but it has been bundled and it has been on sale... and at the reduced price its a must, its just too much fun and quite addictive.

39420355.review:
j'ai adoré jouer a ce jeux mais je trouve qu'il manque...un petit quelque chose pour nous accrocher.C'est peut être moi mais je trouve le jeux un peu lassant a force.

bref un bon jeux au gameplay riche,un peu répetitif certe,mais qui a de la ressource!

39071557.review:
If you liked the Terran vs. Zerg Starcraft missions, this will certainly scratch your itch. Bonus points if you like tower defense. Infested Planet boils down the extreneous resource management and base building elements of an RTS into something more streamlined and intuitive, making for a very satisfying and fun game.

I can't really recommend this game at full price, however. There isn't much replay value. The campaign is at its most fun when you're unlocking the various buildings/upgrades, but at a certain point it just starts throwing money at you. Even when you abandon a game, you still get money, so any sense of progression eventually ceases when everything's unlocked before the campaign is even over. After that, there's just a weekly challenge and a skirmish mode. I can't comment on the planetary campaign, which is sold separately.

Side note: Unfortunately this game evidently suffers from stuttering/slowdown issues if you don't meet the absolute highest system requirements. My laptop's dual core 2.7 GHz processor is apparently not quite good enough (tried all other options), so if you're planning to play it on an old laptop or something that doesn't have a quad core, you may run into problems. Still playable, but annoying, as you'll go into slow motion every few seconds when there are a lot of units on the screen.

38928037.review:
적을알고 나를 알아도 이기는건 어렵다.

시간이 지날수록 변화무쌍한 적을 이기기 위해선 아군 또한 그에 맞춰서 대응해야하는 게임입니다.

이 게임은 철저히 플레이어의 판단력을 시험합니다.
외계 진영의 진화요소와 끝없이 퍼지는 적의 공세를 막기 위해 끊임없이 집중해야하죠.

대신, 플레이어에게 주어진 자원은 유한하나 재활용이 가능합니다.
한번 사용한 것은 다시 환급이 가능하죠.
적을 방어하기 위한 건물을 부숴도 생기는 손실은 없습니다.
필요하지 않은 아군을 제외시켜도 사라지는 포인트는 없습니다.
게임 시스템이 플레이어의 플레이 방식 또한 외계에 맞춰 진화하게 만든거 같군요.

손이 느려도 상관없습니다, 판단력이 느려도 괜찮습니다.
오직 적절하고 제대로된 판단만을 내리면 됩니다.
일시정지가 있으니까요.

빌리언즈를 하고 간만에 하니 역시 재밌습니다.
평가를 미리 적어둘걸 그랬네요.

40856647.review:
Infested Planet is a fast paced RTS that uses the basic idea of "How would you handle a zerg rush?"

I might seem offputting at first for poeple who prefer slower paced RTSs but the game eases you into the chaos before it unleashes it on you. There is not much base building however you can buy certain upgrades that allow you to place strctures that will then give you a bit of an edge in battle, like calling in airstrikes, creating a shield around bases or healing your units.

One thing you learn pretty quickly is that the aliens will not wait for you to build up your forces (which are limited by points which can only be gained by conquering alien swarms). If you wait too long, the number of aliens will become too much to handle, especially if your bases are spread out and thinly defended and the aliens mutate and become stronger with each hive they lose. This encourages and pretty much forces you to "swarm" just like the aliens do. Your soldiers can take quite the beating so don't be afraid to send them into the fray, however pick your line of attack carefully and make sure your soldier's weapons are upgraded and they have grenades/rockets. 

You also have to pay attention  to everyhting going on on the map. If aliens break through and destroy one of the bases, they will create a new hive. If that happens behind your defensive lines, you're royally f***ed.

Simple to learn, less simple to master but a lot of fun and not as unforgiving as it might seem at first (depending on which of the 4 difficulty options you choose).

40830616.review: Muy buen juego de estrategia, simple y adictivo, no es un tower defense exactamente, al menos no como lo puede ser Kingdom Rush por ejemplo. En este juego controlas a un grupo de marines (Empiezas con 5) y se trata de ir conquistando los nidos de los bichos, ellos van sufriendo mutaciones y haciéndose más fuertes, evolucionando etc, tu por contra puedes también mejorar a tus marines y construir pequeñas defensas (campos de minas, torretas, etc)

40662073.review:
This game is just awesome.

When I saw the game announced years ago on armorgames I knew it would be awesome.

Buying the game didn't disappoint me in the slightest, 
the gameplay is challenging (in fact with 4 difficulty setting that you can choose at the start of every level, as challenging as you want), 
the progression is nice,
it has a lot of strategical depths and some level of multitasking.

Also it has a spacebar pause function (where you can still give commands to units), so if you easily get overwhelmed by strategy games, then you can always slow the game to your pace and plan your strategy carefully at any point in time or take a break.

40662034.review:
Deeper strategy than you might think at first sight.

It's also important to know that the campaign isn't the whole game. It's basically a tutorial that prepares you for the full game. Once you complete the campaign and unlock all the goodies you're ready to take on the harder challenges.

40653611.review:
Nie wiem czy można nazwać to typowym tower defensem, ale na pewno można nazwać grą akcji z elementami strategicznymi, choć troche z tower defensa też coś ma. Cały problem polega na niczym innym, jak eliminowaniu pełnych złóż obcych, którzy stale starają się przebić przez nasza obronę, aby całkowicie zdemolować naszą bazę, a my....
Staramy się zrobić dokładnie to samo w stosunku do nich. Na stanie mamy kilku żołnierzy, którzy nie dość, że muszą bronić swego terenu, to jeszcze atakować jednocześnie wroga. Nasza armię możemy ulepszać i dodawać pewnie udogodnienią dla nich samych jak i budowli.

Ogólnie mówiąc... aby wygrać trzeba trochę pomyśleć jak to zrobić. Mi się podoba - pełny pozytyw.

40598439.review: Many games have you dealing with many enemies at once, but Infested Planet is one of the few games that FEELS like you are being swarmed relentlessly. Strangely, unless you crank the difficulty up high, it's a satisfying and relaxing game that constantly rewards sound strategy with clear progress. It doesn't punish experimentation, in fact it rewards you and pushes you to alter your tactics depending on how the enemies mutate. I recommend getting the planetary campaign DLC, it adds a fun layer on top of the battles.

40266757.review:
This is a relatively simple RTS game with the focus on a small squad of soldiers who throw down defensive buildings and science upgrades from time to time. Your dudes respawn when they die and you have to push back (or just survive) onslaughts of bug-aliens with tons of various abilities.

It's not as difficult or strategic as the Creeper World games (which I love), but one thing that I ended up really appreciating about this is that there was no saving in the middle of levels. At first it was frustrating, as some of the levels can be difficult, especially at higher settings. But over-extending, getting crushed, and having to rapidly secure a new 'main' location made for a lot of exciting gameplay and good replayability.

Overall a fun game. Definitely worth a playthrough or two, especially if you can catch it on sale.

40257586.review:

Dommage qu'il n'y ait pas de multijoueur ou de coop et ça a déjà été abordé mais il me semble que la personne est seul à faire le jeu si je me souviens bien et ça représenterait un boulot énorme en plus.

J'ai fais un let's play du jeu sur ma chaîne Youtube si jamais et je le recommande vivement.
